summary: General fire information for Sand Fire
Evacuations:
Evacuation orders were lifted at 5:00 p.m. yesterday for resident re-population.  Area is still under an advisory evacuation.  Fire personnel are extinguishing hot spots.


Information boards: Beginning Monday, June 10, 3 locations; Station 23(3794 CA-16, Guinda), Boy Scout Camp (16980 Yolo Ave.) and Guinda Corner Store (7530 CA-16).
Road Closures: Hwy 16 will open at 12:00 p.m. today.  Please be aware of emergency vehicles in the fire area.
Cooperating Agencies: CAL FIRE, Cal OES, Yolo County Sheriff, CHP, NBIMT and multiple local government  fire agencies.
Conditions: Firefighters are currently working a wildland fire in the Capay Valley area near the town of Guinda.  The fire was reported at a rapid rate of spread and is on steep brush covered slopes.  Weather in the area is expected to be hot with winds up to 7 mph.
